[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Dependency: self_update crate] [Third-party Crate Security] Does the self_update crate (imported at lines 21-25) have its own vulnerabilities in release fetching, binary download, or installation that could be exploited? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Dependency: self_update crate] [Transitive Dependencies] Are the transitive dependencies of self_update (HTTP clients, TLS libraries, etc.) regularly audited for vulnerabilities that could compromise the update process? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: build_updater()] [Update Backend Security] The Update::configure() uses the GitHub backend by default - are there configuration options that could be exploited to use insecure backends or protocols? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: get_update_info()] [API Rate Limiting] Does the code handle GitHub API rate limiting gracefully, or can repeated update checks exhaust rate limits and prevent legitimate updates? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: get_update_info()] [Authentication Token] Does the ReleaseList configuration support authentication tokens, and if so, are they properly secured against exposure in logs or error messages? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: get_update_info()] [API Response Validation] Are GitHub API responses validated for well-formedness and expected schema, or can malformed responses cause panics or undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: get_update_info()] [Pagination Handling] The comment mentions only checking last 30 items (default API page size) - is there pagination support to check beyond 30 releases if needed? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: build_updater()] [Elevated Privileges] If the CLI is installed system-wide in /usr/bin or similar, does the update process require elevated privileges, and if so, are they properly requested and validated? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: from_env()] [Setuid Binary Detection] If the aptos binary has setuid/setgid bits set, does the installation detection account for this, and are updates prevented in such cases? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: build_updater()] [Permission Checks] Before replacing the binary, are file permissions and ownership checked to prevent privilege escalation via world-writable binaries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Struct: AptosUpdateTool] [Command-line Injection] Can the --repo-owner and --repo-name arguments accept special shell characters that get improperly escaped in downstream commands? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Struct: AptosUpdateTool] [Config File Override] Are there configuration files (TOML, YAML, etc.) that can override the default repo settings, and if so, are they properly validated? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Struct: AptosUpdateTool] [Environment Variable Override] Can environment variables like APTOS_REPO_OWNER override the clap defaults, potentially enabling supply chain attacks via environment manipulation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: build_updater()] [Post-Download Validation] After downloading the binary, is there any validation that the downloaded file is actually a valid executable for the current platform? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: build_updater()] [Binary Size Validation] Is there a reasonable size limit on downloaded binaries to prevent disk exhaustion attacks via oversized malicious binaries? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: build_updater()] [File Type Validation] Does the update process validate the downloaded file's magic bytes or file type to ensure it's actually an executable and not an arbitrary file? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: build_updater()] [Backup Creation] Does the update process create a backup of the old binary before replacement, and if so, is the backup properly secured? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: get_update_info()] [HTTPS Enforcement] Does the self_update crate enforce HTTPS for all GitHub API and asset download requests, or can it be downgraded to HTTP? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: build_updater()] [Certificate Pinning] Is there certificate pinning for GitHub's TLS certificates to prevent MITM attacks via compromised certificate authorities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: get_update_info()] [Proxy Configuration] If HTTP proxies are configured in the environment, are they properly validated to prevent proxy-based MITM attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: build_updater()] [DNS Security] Does the update process validate DNS responses to prevent DNS spoofing attacks redirecting to malicious GitHub-lookalike servers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: build_updater()] [Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use] Between get_update_info() determining an update is needed and build_updater() performing it, can the GitHub release be modified or deleted? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: get_update_info()] [Stale Release Data] If release data is cached anywhere in the self_update crate, can stale data cause installation of outdated or revoked releases? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos/src/update/aptos.rs] [Function: build_updater()] [Binary Lock File] Is there a lock file or mutex preventing concurrent update processes from interfering with each other? (Medium)
